name: Telia Company AB
bossPosition: SVP, Group General Counsel and Head of Corporate Affairs
membership: We are members of ETNO - European Telecommunications Network Operators' Association, GSMA and Global Network Initiative: https://www.teliacompany.com/en/about-the-company/public-policy/ .
goal:
Telia Company, the new generation telco, provides communication services helping millions of people to be connected and to communicate, do business and be entertained. Headquartered in Stockholm, we offer services in the Nordic and Baltic region (Sweden, Finland, Denmark, Norway, Estonia, Lithuania and Latvia). We also have mobile operations in Moldova. Telia Carrier's fiber backbone runs around the world and is the second largest in the world. The services and solutions we provide include mobile voice and data, fixed voice data, IP capacity, TV and media, internet of things, cloud, security, ICT and other solutions.

Founded in the 1850s, we are the pioneers of the telecom industry, one of the inventors of mobile communications and founders of GSM. We work with an ecosystem of new start-ups and major service providers to provide the infrastructure for creativity, growth and change.

The main tasks of Telia Company office in Brussels are to follow policy developments and debates affecting company's operations, to maintain an open and transparent dialogue with the policy makers and stakeholders, bringing forward the perspective of one of the world’s most advanced digital regions.
interests: Business and Industry, Competition, Consumers, Culture and media, Digital economy and society, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Research and innovation, Single market, Taxation, Trans-European Networks, Youth
euInitiatives: Digital Single Market initiatives, European Electronic Communications Code, ePrivacy Regulation, General Data Protection Regulation, 5G Action Plan, Telecom/Digital Single Market Regulation, Wholesale Roaming Regulation, Network and Information Security Directive, Cybersecurity Act, Audiovisual Media Services Directive, Content Portability Regulation.
